import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
## I seperated the Indices file to 6 csv files by investment_style

B = pd.read_csv('Index-B.csv')
F = pd.read_csv('Index-F.csv')
T = pd.read_csv('Index-T.csv')
TA = pd.read_csv('Index-TA.csv')
PP = pd.read_csv('Index-PP.csv')
W = pd.read_csv('Index-W.csv')

B.sort_values(by=['investor_type', 'id'], inplace=True)
F.sort_values(by=['investor_type', 'id'], inplace=True)
T.sort_values(by=['investor_type', 'id'], inplace=True)
TA.sort_values(by=['investor_type', 'id'], inplace=True)
PP.sort_values(by=['investor_type', 'id'], inplace=True)
W.sort_values(by=['investor_type', 'id'], inplace=True)
## Seperate each investment_style by investor_type

# Day-Trader
B_DT=B[B['investor_type']=='DT'] # B_DT has no data
F_DT=F[F['investor_type']=='DT'] # F_DT has 8 rows of data
T_DT=T[T['investor_type']=='DT'] # T_DT has 8 rows of data
TA_DT=TA[TA['investor_type']=='DT'] # TA_DT has 121 rows of data
PP_DT=PP[PP['investor_type']=='DT'] # PP_DT has 89 rows of data
W_DT=W[W['investor_type']=='DT'] # W_DT has 120 rows of data

# Value-Investor
B_VI=B[B['investor_type']=='VI'] # B_VI has 89 rows of data
F_VI=F[F['investor_type']=='VI'] # F_VI has 85 rows of data
T_VI=T[T['investor_type']=='VI'] # T_VI has 85 rows of data
TA_VI=TA[TA['investor_type']=='VI'] # TA_VI has 8 rows of data
PP_VI=PP[PP['investor_type']=='VI'] # PP_VI no data
W_VI=W[W['investor_type']=='VI'] # W_VI has no data
## Now I seperate each by the time horizon
- D, W, M, Q, A

# B:
B_DT_D=B_DT[B_DT['time_horizon']=='D'] # B_DT_D has no data
B_DT_W=B_DT[B_DT['time_horizon']=='W'] # B_DT_W has no data
B_DT_M=B_DT[B_DT['time_horizon']=='M'] # B_DT_M has no data
B_DT_Q=B_DT[B_DT['time_horizon']=='Q'] # B_DT_Q has no data
B_DT_A=B_DT[B_DT['time_horizon']=='A'] # B_DT_A has no data

B_VI_D=B_VI[B_VI['time_horizon']=='D'] # B_VI_D has no data
B_VI_W=B_VI[B_VI['time_horizon']=='W'] # B_VI_W has no data
B_VI_M=B_VI[B_VI['time_horizon']=='M'] # B_VI_M has no data
B_VI_Q=B_VI[B_VI['time_horizon']=='Q'] # B_VI_Q 43 rows
B_VI_A=B_VI[B_VI['time_horizon']=='A'] # B_VI_A 44 rows

# F:
F_DT_D=F_DT[F_DT['time_horizon']=='D'] # F_DT_D 8 rows
F_DT_W=F_DT[F_DT['time_horizon']=='W'] # F_DT_W has no data
F_DT_M=F_DT[F_DT['time_horizon']=='M'] # F_DT_M has no data
F_DT_Q=F_DT[F_DT['time_horizon']=='Q'] # F_DT_Q has no data
F_DT_A=F_DT[F_DT['time_horizon']=='A'] # F_DT_A has no data

F_VI_D=F_VI[F_VI['time_horizon']=='D'] # F_VI_D has no data
F_VI_W=F_VI[F_VI['time_horizon']=='W'] # F_VI_W has no data
F_VI_M=F_VI[F_VI['time_horizon']=='M'] # F_VI_M has no data
F_VI_Q=F_VI[F_VI['time_horizon']=='Q'] # F_VI_Q 43 rows
F_VI_A=F_VI[F_VI['time_horizon']=='A'] # F_VI_A 42 rows

# T:
T_DT_D=T_DT[T_DT['time_horizon']=='D'] # T_DT_D 8 rows
T_DT_W=T_DT[T_DT['time_horizon']=='W'] # T_DT_W has no data
T_DT_M=T_DT[T_DT['time_horizon']=='M'] # T_DT_M has no data
T_DT_Q=T_DT[T_DT['time_horizon']=='Q'] # T_DT_Q has no data
T_DT_A=T_DT[T_DT['time_horizon']=='A'] # T_DT_A has no data

T_VI_D=T_VI[T_VI['time_horizon']=='D'] # T_VI_D has no data
T_VI_W=T_VI[T_VI['time_horizon']=='W'] # T_VI_W has no data
T_VI_M=T_VI[T_VI['time_horizon']=='M'] # T_VI_M has no data
T_VI_Q=T_VI[T_VI['time_horizon']=='Q'] # T_VI_Q 44 rows
T_VI_A=T_VI[T_VI['time_horizon']=='A'] # T_VI_A 41 rows

# TA:
TA_DT_D=TA_DT[TA_DT['time_horizon']=='D'] # TA_DT_D 34 rows
TA_DT_W=TA_DT[TA_DT['time_horizon']=='W'] # TA_DT_W 43 rows
TA_DT_M=TA_DT[TA_DT['time_horizon']=='M'] # TA_DT_M 44 rows
TA_DT_Q=TA_DT[TA_DT['time_horizon']=='Q'] # TA_DT_Q has no data
TA_DT_A=TA_DT[TA_DT['time_horizon']=='A'] # TA_DT_A has no data

TA_VI_D=TA_VI[TA_VI['time_horizon']=='D'] # TA_VI_D has no data
TA_VI_W=TA_VI[TA_VI['time_horizon']=='W'] # TA_VI_W has no data
TA_VI_M=TA_VI[TA_VI['time_horizon']=='M'] # TA_VI_M has no data
TA_VI_Q=TA_VI[TA_VI['time_horizon']=='Q'] # TA_VI_Q 1 rows
TA_VI_A=TA_VI[TA_VI['time_horizon']=='A'] # TA_VI_A 7 rows

# PP:
PP_DT_D=PP_DT[PP_DT['time_horizon']=='D'] # PP_DT_D NO DATA
PP_DT_W=PP_DT[PP_DT['time_horizon']=='W'] # PP_DT_W 45 rows
PP_DT_M=PP_DT[PP_DT['time_horizon']=='M'] # PP_DT_M 44 rows
PP_DT_Q=PP_DT[PP_DT['time_horizon']=='Q'] # PP_DT_Q has no data
PP_DT_A=PP_DT[PP_DT['time_horizon']=='A'] # PP_DT_A has no data

PP_VI_D=PP_VI[PP_VI['time_horizon']=='D'] # PP_VI_D has no data
PP_VI_W=PP_VI[PP_VI['time_horizon']=='W'] # PP_VI_W has no data
PP_VI_M=PP_VI[PP_VI['time_horizon']=='M'] # PP_VI_M has no data
PP_VI_Q=PP_VI[PP_VI['time_horizon']=='Q'] # PP_VI_Q has no data
PP_VI_A=PP_VI[PP_VI['time_horizon']=='A'] # PP_VI_A has no data

# W:
W_DT_D=W_DT[W_DT['time_horizon']=='D'] # W_DT_D 36 rows
W_DT_W=W_DT[W_DT['time_horizon']=='W'] # W_DT_W 42 ROWS
W_DT_M=W_DT[W_DT['time_horizon']=='M'] # W_DT_M 42 ROWS
W_DT_Q=W_DT[W_DT['time_horizon']=='Q'] # W_DT_Q has no data
W_DT_A=W_DT[W_DT['time_horizon']=='A'] # W_DT_A has no data

W_VI_D=W_VI[W_VI['time_horizon']=='D'] # W_VI_D has no data
W_VI_W=W_VI[W_VI['time_horizon']=='W'] # W_VI_W has no data
W_VI_M=W_VI[W_VI['time_horizon']=='M'] # W_VI_M has no data
W_VI_Q=W_VI[W_VI['time_horizon']=='Q'] # W_VI_Q has no data
W_VI_A=W_VI[W_VI['time_horizon']=='A'] # W_VI_A has no data
# Calculate daily returns for each one
### Then get mean and stdev and check for Jumps
## 1) a) B_DT (NO DATA)

B_DT_D_returns = B_DT_D['index'].pct_change()
B_DT_D_drift = B_DT_D_returns.sum()
B_DT_D_stdev = B_DT_D_returns.std()

B_DT_W_returns = B_DT_W['index'].pct_change()
B_DT_W_drift = B_DT_W_returns.sum()
B_DT_W_stdev = B_DT_W_returns.std()

B_DT_M_returns = B_DT_M['index'].pct_change()
B_DT_M_drift = B_DT_M_returns.sum()
B_DT_M_stdev = B_DT_M_returns.std()

B_DT_Q_returns = B_DT_Q['index'].pct_change()
B_DT_Q_drift = B_DT_Q_returns.sum()
B_DT_Q_stdev = B_DT_Q_returns.std()

B_DT_A_returns = B_DT_A['index'].pct_change()
B_DT_A_drift = B_DT_A_returns.sum()
B_DT_A_stdev = B_DT_A_returns.std()

print("B_DT_D max daily deviation=", B_DT_D_returns.min()) # checking for jump down only
print("B_DT_W max daily deviation=", B_DT_W_returns.min())
print("B_DT_M max daily deviation=", B_DT_M_returns.min())
print("B_DT_Q max daily deviation=", B_DT_Q_returns.min())
print("B_DT_A max daily deviation=", B_DT_A_returns.min())

plt.plot(B_DT_D['index'],  label="D")
plt.plot(B_DT_W['index'],  label="W")
plt.plot(B_DT_M['index'],  label="M")
plt.plot(B_DT_Q['index'],  label="Q")
plt.plot(B_DT_A['index'],  label="A")
plt.legend()
plt.show()

plt.hist(B_DT_D_returns, bins=50, label="D")
plt.hist(B_DT_W_returns, bins=50, label="W")
plt.hist(B_DT_M_returns, bins=50, label="M")
plt.hist(B_DT_Q_returns, bins=50, label="Q")
plt.hist(B_DT_A_returns, bins=50, label="A")
plt.xlim(-0.2, 0.2)
plt.legend()
plt.show()
## b) B_VI

# This is the Geometric Brownian Motion Simulation

##### 1) It's best used for "equilibirum" market conditions, where there are no daily ups/downs exceeding 10% (which makes more sense for indexes)

##### 2) We can check the historical long-term trend (yrl % change) and historical stdev and run the simulation to see all different possibilities

##### 3) We can also allow users to input their own subjective long-term trend (from price predictions) or if we believe the next month will be very volatile we can increase the stdev in simulation and see the possibilities

##### 4) This model is also useful to determine if put options are over/under priced:
- We can input the vol_real as the Implied Volatility of the option and calculate the average ending price of the simulation (which should be the fair price of the options)

## Example: Simulation for PP_DT_W

T=120  ## This is the simulation period (days)
drift = PP_DT_W_drift   ## this is the long-term trend in the simulation
vol_real = PP_DT_W_stdev*np.sqrt(T)  ## historical daily stdev then multiply by sqrt(T)

dt=1/T
N=100   ## This is the number of simulations

last_price = []
pct_change = []
pt = []

for i in range(N):
    prices=[]
    S= 100    ## Starting price of index in simulation

    for t in range(T):
        ## Geometric Brownian Motion Simulation
        S=S*np.exp((drift-0.5*vol_real**2)*dt+vol_real*np.sqrt(dt)*np.random.normal(0,1))
        prices=np.append(prices, S)
        tau=(T-t)/365

    last_price = np.append(last_price, S)
 
    pt = np.diff(prices)/prices[1:]         
    pct_change = np.append(pct_change, pt)
    #plt.subplot(2,1,1)
    plt.plot(prices)   
    #plt.subplot(2,1,2)
    #plt.scatter(np.linspace(0,T-1, T), prices, color="black", alpha=0.01)

plt.show()

plt.hist(last_price, bins=50, density=True)
plt.title("Final Price Distribution")
plt.show()


print("average ending price= $", np.average(last_price))
print("max ending price= $", np.max(last_price))
print("min ending price= $", np.min(last_price), '\n')

print("average PnL= $", np.average(last_price)-100)
print("worst loss= $", np.min(last_price)-100)
print("max gain= $", np.max(last_price)-100, '\n')

x1 = (last_price/100)>1.1
count1 = np.count_nonzero(x1)
print("Probability of 10% gain=(%)", count1/len(x1)*100)

x2 = (last_price/100)>1.2
count2 = np.count_nonzero(x2)

# Jump-Diffusion Simulation

###### 1- For this model, it's best to check in the historical data to see if the index ever had a daily jump in value (>15% in one day)
##### 2- a) We can also use this model if we believe there will be a crash like scenario (like COVID)
#####     b) We can also use it for "Coinbase Effect" events to test for jumps up
   
##### 3- The best use case of this simulation model is to hedge black swan events using out-the-money put options, to see which puts would be most profitable as insurance

### Example: TA_DT_M

S0 = 100   ## Starting price of Index

T=1
N_T=120   ## Number of days in simulation
N_S=100   ## Number of Simulations

r = TA_DT_M_drift       ## this is mu; this is long-term trend
sigma = TA_DT_M_stdev*np.sqrt(N_T)  ## historical daily stdev then multiply by sqrt(T)

lmda_J = 1  # Jump Frequency (# per N_T), so the number of jumps/simulation on average
mu_J = 0.20  # mean of jump (jump magnitude in %)
sigma_J = 0.20  # standard deviation of jump magnitude

## This means that on average we will have (lmda_J) jumps per simulation but sometimes more/less
## On average the magnitude of the jump is 20%, but it could be more/less (stdev=0.2)

dt = T/N_T;
kappa = np.exp(mu_J) - 1;
drift = r  - lmda_J*kappa - 0.5*sigma**2;
S = []
j=1
last_price=[]
pct_change=[]
all=[]
g = 0

ETH_pnl=[]
total_pnl = []
jump_day=[]
num_jumps=[]
jump_magnitude=[]

for i in range(N_S):
    
    ## Merton Jump-Diffusion Simulation
    S = S0
    price=[]
    jumps=[]
    
    for j in range(N_T):
      
      J = 0

      if lmda_J != 0:
                
        Nt = np.random.poisson(lmda_J*dt)
        
        if Nt > 0:

          for k in range(Nt):
              
            J = J + np.random.normal(mu_J - (sigma_J**2)/2, sigma_J)
            jumps = np.append(jumps, J) 
            #jump_day=np.append(jump_day, k) 
      Z = np.random.normal(0,1)
      S = S*np.exp(drift*dt + sigma*np.sqrt(dt)*Z + J)
      price = np.append(price, S)
      pt = np.diff(price)/price[1:] 

    pct_change = np.append(pct_change, pt)

    last_price = np.append(last_price, S)
    plt.plot(TA_DT_M['index'][:41]-85,  label="M") ## I did -85 so that index starts at $100
    plt.scatter(np.linspace(0,N_T-1, N_T), price,  color="black", alpha=0.05)
    all=np.append(all, price)

    ETH_rev = S - S0 
    num_jumps=np.append(num_jumps, len(jumps))
    jump_magnitude=np.append(jump_magnitude, jumps)
    

plt.show()

print("Index long-term trend (input) =", TA_DT_M_drift, '\n')
print("Index stdev (input)=", sigma, '\n')

print("average ending price= $", np.average(last_price))
print("max ending price= $", np.max(last_price))
print("min ending price= $", np.min(last_price), '\n')

print("average PnL= $", np.average(last_price)-100)
print("50% of PnLs are above: $", np.median(last_price)-100, '\n')
print("worst loss= $", np.min(last_price)-100)
print("max gain= $", np.max(last_price)-100, '\n')




print("Average # of Jumps:", np.mean(num_jumps))
print("Avergae Jump magnitude(%):", np.mean(jump_magnitude)*100, '\n')

plt.hist(last_price, bins=50, density=True)
plt.title("Final Price Distribution")
plt.show()


x1 = (last_price/100)>1.1
count1 = np.count_nonzero(x1)
print("Probability of 10% gain=(%)", count1/len(x1)*100)

x2 = (last_price/100)>1.2
count2 = np.count_nonzero(x2)
print("Probability of 20% gain=(%)", count2/len(x2)*100)

x3 = (last_price/100)>1.5
count5 = np.count_nonzero(x3)
print("Probability of 50% gain=(%)", count5/len(x3)*100, '\n')

x4 = (last_price/100)>2
count6 = np.count_nonzero(x4)
print("Probability of 100% gain=(%)", count6/len(x4)*100, '\n')

y1 = (last_price/100)<0.9
count3 = np.count_nonzero(y1)
print("Probability of 10% loss=(%)", count3/len(y1)*100)

y2 = (last_price/100)<0.8
count4 = np.count_nonzero(y2)
print("Probability of 20% loss=(%)", count4/len(y2)*100, '\n')

y3 = (last_price/100)<0.05

print("Probability of Ruin =(%)", count7/len(y3)*100, '\n')
